fields.Title of Presentation: Remembering Our Way Forward: The importance of our stories
fields.Description/Abstract:
This paper blurs disciplinary boundaries while dissecting the phenomena of teacher
burnout, from an insider’s perspective, using the conference theme of “Memory, Remembering
& Forgetting: Re-envisioning Educational Worlds.” Pulling from the fields of auto-ethnography,
sociology, philosophy, organizational change theory and dispute resolution, the paper
conceptualizes teacher burnout as a phenomenon of dysfunctional change and conflict between
different internal versions of ourselves. First, it addresses teacher burnout in a way that honors
teachers’ lives and the stories that shape them. Second, it gives voice to teachers who are often
voiceless within the larger arena of public education. In conclusion, we aim to explore the role
of memory, remembering and forgetting as key aspects in contributing to both the genesis of
feeling of burnout and frustration, as well as resolution of such feelings.
